snippet: While Gazprom has long controlled Russia’s natural gas exports to Europe, the Kremlin is reportedly allowing Novatek to begin exporting gas to Germany, a shift that once seemed inconceivable.
abstract: Gazprom has long controlled Russia’s natural gas exports to Europe, but the Kremlin is reportedly allowing Novatek to begin exporting gas to Germany, a shift that once seemed inconceivable; Novatek reaches agreement with Energie Baden-Wurttenberg for the delivery of 2 billion cubic meters of natural gas annually.
lead_paragraph: While Gazprom has long controlled Russia’s natural gas exports to Europe, the Kremlin is reportedly allowing Novatek to begin exporting gas to Germany, a shift that once seemed inconceivable.

headline.seo: Novatek May Break Gazprom Monopoly on Russian Gas Exports
headline.main: Novatek May Break Russian Gas Export Monopoly
headline.print_headline: Novatek May Break Russian Gas Export Monopoly
